meanings.definition: To make a springing or bounding motion.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was boinging around the yard happily.
meanings.sent2: The kangaroo was boinging through the grasslands.
meanings.sent3: The ball was boinging so much, it seemed like it had springs inside.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was boinging with excitement as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter boinging in the playground echoed in the air.

meanings.definition: The act of bouncing or rebounding.
meanings.sent1: The boinging of the basketball could be heard across the court.
meanings.sent2: The boinging of the trampoline brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent3: The boinging of the rubber ball against the wall was rhythmic.
meanings.sent4: The boinging of the spring in the door made a funny noise.
meanings.sent5: The boinging of the pogo stick was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A sound made by something springing back or vibrating.
meanings.sent1: The boinging of the guitar string filled the room with music.
meanings.sent2: The boinging of the metal spring was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent3: The boinging of the diving board made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The boinging of the elastic band snapped loudly.
meanings.sent5: The boinging of the doorstopper startled the cat.
